<div id="content_main_columnControl_13">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_17" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_5">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="Android-pay"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Google Pay
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_16" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <h3><strong>What is Google Pay?</strong><br> </h3>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_17" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Google Pay is one of the Mobile Payments solutions available to HSBC personal card cardholders. It provides a simple and secure way to pay using your compatible Android devices. Choose your device and add your HSBC credit card to Google Pay app to make transactions with your Android device in stores or in app.</p>

</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_6" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_5" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="1193950241__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="1193950241__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other Google Pay FAQs </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="1193950241__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_14">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_18" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_18" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is Google Pay secure?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">By creating a unique virtual account number for your payment information, your name and full card details are never shown in the app and never shared with the store. Google stores your payment information on secure servers and encrypts it with industry-standard SSL (secure socket layer) technology. For added security, you will be asked to unlock your device for certain payments from time to time. If your phone is ever lost or stolen, you can easily find, lock, or erase your phone using Android Device Manager (<a href="https://www.google.com/android/devicemanager" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">https://www.google.com/android/devicemanager</span><span class="visuallyhidden">https://www.google.com/android/devicemanager  This link will open in a new window</span></a>).</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To protect your card, keep your device under your personal control at all times. Depending on the model of your device, you may be able to turn off the NFC function when you are not using the Mobile Credit Card. If you have lost your device along with your Mobile Credit Card, please report to the bank using the telephone numbers on the back of your HSBC Credit Card as soon as possible.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Which devices are compatible with Google Pay?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Google Pay works with most NFC capable Android? devices running Android 4.4 (KitKat?) or higher.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Which HSBC credit card can I use to apply for Google Pay?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Any of the below personal HKD HSBC Visa and MasterCard credit cards are eligible for Google Pay: HSBC Premier MasterCard Credit Card, Visa Signature Card, Visa Platinum Card, green Credit Card, Visa Gold Card, Visa Card, iCan Card, Master Gold Card and Master Card.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What do I need to use Google Pay?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You must have the below to use Google Pay: <br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">1) An NFC capable Android? devices running Android 4.4 (KitKat?) or higher;</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">2) The Google Pay app downloaded from Google Play Store. If the phone is not compatible, you will not be able to download Google Pay; </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">3) An eligible HSBC credit cards as below:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">HSBC Premier MasterCard Credit Card, Visa Signature Card, Visa Platinum Card, green Credit Card, Visa Gold Card, Visa Card, iCan Card, Master Gold Card and Master Card.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">With the above, you can proceed to add a card to Google Pay app to enjoy simple and secure way to pay.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I apply for Google Pay?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For all HSBC Visa and MasterCard credit cards, please log on to the HSBC HK App and follow the below instructions to add them to Google Pay:</p> 
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Select the credit card you want to add</li> 
 <li>Select "View more" and then "Manage credit cards"</li> 
 <li>Select the "Add to G Pay" banner to start the process</li> 
 <li>Agree to the disclaimer and select "Get verification code"</li> 
 <li>Input the OTP SMS and confirm</li> 
</ol> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">HSBC UnionPay Credit Cards are not supported by Google Pay at the moment.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>When I am adding my card, I have been prompted for a verification code via SMS. What is this and why is it required?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For security purposes, we may ask you to enter a verification code to confirm your identity. If prompted, please follow on-screen instruction to receive and enter the verification code. If you fail to enter the verification code or the verification code is expired, please contact us on <a href="tel:+852-2233-3000" class="no-link" role="presentation">2233 3000</a>. HSBC Global Private Banking, Premier Elite and HSBC Premier customers can call <a href="tel:+852-2233-3033" class="no-link" role="presentation">2233 3033</a> and <a href="tel:+852-2233-3322" class="no-link" role="presentation">2233 3322</a> respectively.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can additional cardholders apply for Google Pay?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, additional cardholders can apply for Google Pay using their additional cards. If your additional cardholder applies for the Google Pay successfully, both you and your additional cardholder will receive an email confirmation on the service. The use of Google Pay will be governed by a new mobile credit card addendum to credit card cardholder agreement which will need to be accepted during service application.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I use Google Pay if I have other HSBC Mobile Payments service (such as Apple Pay)?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, you can add your card to your compatible device to use Google Pay.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I keep using Google Pay if I cancel my linked HSBC plastic card?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No, your Google Pay and your HSBC plastic card share the same card account. Your Google Pay will be cancelled together with the plastic card.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I use Google Pay with a rooted device?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No. Google Pay can only work on device which is not rooted.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is Google Pay free to use?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">HSBC will not charge you any additional fee for using Google Pay.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Where can I use Google Pay?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can use Google Pay in stores with Visa payWave or MasterCard contactless payment terminals. You can also make in-app purchases where Google Pay is provided as a payment option.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I use Google Pay overseas?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, you can use Google Pay overseas in the stores with Visa payWave or MasterCard contactless payment terminals. You are advised to bring your HSBC plastic card with you for travel in case Google Pay is not accepted.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Do I need to connect to internet when I am using Google Pay?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Internet access is required during setup or to refresh the information of your past transactions. <br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In most circumstances you do not need internet connection to transact using Google Pay. However, occasionally you may be required to connect to the internet, for example after a device restart.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is there any limit for each transaction?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Transaction limit depends on the setting of the contactless terminal. For some of the contactless terminals, there is no transaction limit and you can transact up to your available credit limit; for some others, there might be a transaction limit of HK$500 or HK$1,000. Occasionally, your device will prompt you to unlock your device for some of the transactions. Follow the on-screen instruction and hold your device close to the payment terminal. For transactions that cannot be accepted by Google Pay, please use your HSBC plastic card.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Where can I check my transactions?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can check all your transactions made via Google Pay in HSBC Internet Banking, HSBC Mobile Banking App or the credit card statement. Other than that, you can also see the last 10 Google Pay transactions made via your device under your card in the Google Pay app.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Do I earn RewardCash for Google Pay transactions?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Google Pay transactions are treated the same as the other credit card transactions using the same RewardCash mechanism / policy and thus you can earn $1 RewardCash for every HKD250 you spend on Google Pay.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I set my HSBC credit card as the default card for Google Pay?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The first card you add to Google Pay app is your default card. To set your HSBC credit card as default, go to Google Pay app, select the card and tap "Set as default card" Moreover, you can also go to Settings> Google> Google Pay and select your HSBC credit card to make it the default card.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What should I do if I lose my Android device?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can call us on <a href="tel:+852-2233-3000" class="no-link" role="presentation">2233 3000</a> to report loss of your device. HSBC Global Private Banking, Premier Elite and HSBC Premier customers can call <a href="tel:+852-2233-3033" class="no-link" role="presentation">2233 3033</a> and <a href="tel:+852-2233-3322" class="no-link" role="presentation">2233 3322</a> respectively.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Alternatively, you can find, lock, or erase your device using Android Device Manager.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To enable the Android Device Manager, the bank suggest you to take these steps in advance:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">1) Sign in to your Google account on your device in order to use the Android Device Manager</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">2) Turn on the location access under Settings > Location</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">3) Under Settings > Security > Android Device Manager, move the switches next to 'Remotely locate this device' and 'Allow remote lock and factory reset' to the 'On' position</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">*Different device might have different setting menu<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What should I do if I lose my card?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please call us on <a href="tel:+852-2233-3000" class="no-link" role="presentation">2233 3000</a> immediately to report loss. HSBC Global Private Banking, Premier Elite and HSBC Premier customers can call <a href="tel:+852-2233-3033" class="no-link" role="presentation">2233 3033</a> and <a href="tel:+852-2233-3322" class="no-link" role="presentation">2233 3322</a> respectively.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Once your plastic card are reported loss, you will not be able to continue to use Google Pay with this card.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What happens when I change my device to a new model?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you change my device to a new model, you will need to add your card(s) to Google Pay app again. Please ensure that you remove your card(s) from any device before selling, repairing, or disposing of them. You can remove your card by selecting "Remove Card" after you tap onto the card.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What should I do if I want to trade in my phone or want to send my phone for servicing?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You are reminded to remove all your cards in that device by selecting “Remove Card” after you tap onto the card. You might also consider removing all your data (including Google Pay’s payment information) by factory reset or suspending your cards by Android Device Manager (<a href="https://www.google.com/android/devicemanager" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">https://www.google.com/android/devicemanage</span><span class="visuallyhidden">https://www.google.com/android/devicemanage  This link will open in a new window</span></a>r).<br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    

</div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_15">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_19" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_6">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="Samsung-pay"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Samsung Pay
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_19" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <h3><strong>What is Samsung Pay?</strong><br> </h3>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_20" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Samsung Pay is one of the Mobile Payments solutions available to HSBC personal card cardholders. Samsung Pay is a secure and easy-to-use mobile payment service which employs Magnetic Secure Transmission (MST) and Near Field Communication (NFC) technology, making it available almost anywhere accepting credit cards. Add your HSBC credit card to Samsung Pay app to make transactions with your Samsung device in stores or in app.<br>
</p>

</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_7" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_6" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="902800931__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="902800931__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other Samsung pay FAQs </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="902800931__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_16">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_20" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_21" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is Samsung Pay secure?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">When you add a card to Samsung Pay, a device specific digital card is allocated by Card Network through tokenization represents your physical card. The digital card is stored and protected in Secure Environment using Samsung Knox technology. Your physical card details are not stored by Samsung Pay. To ensure each payment is authorised by you, you need to authenticate every payment with your Iris, Fingerprint or a Samsung Pay specific PIN. <br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To protect your card, keep your device under your personal control at all times and do not let others to unlock your device and do not store anyone else’s biometric credentials in your device, or else they might be able to make transactions without your authorization.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Which devices are compatible with Samsung Pay?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Samsung Pay works with Galaxy Note8, Galaxy S8+, Galaxy S8, Galaxy S7 edge, Galaxy S7, Galaxy S6 edge+, Galaxy Note5, Galaxy C9 Pro, Galaxy C7 Pro, Galaxy C5 Pro, Gear S3 and Gear Sport. <br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">* Devices supporting Samsung Pay may update from time to time. Please visit Samsung Pay website for more details.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Which HSBC credit card can I use to apply for Samsung Pay?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Any of the below personal HKD HSBC Visa and MasterCard credit cards are eligible for Samsung Pay: HSBC Premier MasterCard Credit Card, Visa Signature Card, Visa Platinum Card, green Credit Card, Visa Gold Card, Visa Card, iCan Card, Master Gold Card and Master Card.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What do I need to use Samsung Pay?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You must have the below to use Samsung Pay:<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">1) You must have an eligible Samsung device:<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Galaxy Note8, Galaxy S8+, Galaxy S8, Galaxy S7 edge, Galaxy S7, Galaxy S6 edge+, Galaxy Note5, Galaxy C9 Pro, Galaxy C7 Pro, Galaxy C5 Pro, Gear S3 and Gear Sport.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">2) An eligible HSBC credit cards as below:<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">HSBC Premier MasterCard Credit Card, Visa Signature Card, Visa Platinum Card, green Credit Card, Visa Gold Card, Visa Card, iCan Card, Master Gold Card and Master Card.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">With the above, you can proceed to add a card to Samsung Pay to enjoy the fast, easy and private way to pay.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">* Devices supporting Samsung Pay may update from time to time. Please visit Samsung Pay website for more details.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I apply for Samsung Pay?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To add your HSBC MasterCard or Visa Credit Card to Samsung Pay, please follow the instructions below:</p> 
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Open your Samsung wallet app</li> 
 <li>Tap the “Add" button</li> 
 <li>Select "Payment cards"</li> 
 <li>Follow the on-screen instructions and enter your card details</li> 
 <li>Complete verification by calling our contact centre number</li> 
</ol> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">HSBC UnionPay Credit Cards are not supported by Samsung Pay at the moment.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To add your card to Samsung Pay on your Gear, just complete the simple steps as below:</p> 
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Launch Samsung Gear App on your paired Android phone (Android OS4.4 and higher with over 1.5GB RAM).</li> 
 <li>Connect your paired phone to Gear via Bluetooth if it is not already connected.</li> 
 <li>Tap on "Open Samsung Pay" under info tab.</li> 
 <li>Tap on "Add Card" shown on the screen to register your card.</li> 
</ol> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">* You will need to register a new Gear PIN lock if you have not set it before.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">5. Scan your HSBC credit card information, or enter the details manually.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">6. Complete verification by calling our contact centre number.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why I cannot use Samsung Pay even my mobile phone comes with the app?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Samsung Pay is customized for every region for the best customer experience. If you purchase a Samsung Galaxy mobile device from other regions, you will not able to use Samsung Pay.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For device purchase from Hong Kong and Macau, you will need to install a Hong Kong SIM card to use Samsung Pay.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>When I am adding my card, I have been prompted for a verification code via SMS. What is this and why is it required?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For security purposes, we may ask you to enter a verification code to confirm your identity. If prompted, please follow on-screen instruction to receive and enter the verification code. If you fail to enter the verification code or the verification code is expired, please contact us on <a href="tel:+852-2233-3000" class="no-link" role="presentation">2233 3000</a>. HSBC Global Private Banking, Premier Elite and HSBC Premier customers can call <a href="tel:+852-2233-3033" class="no-link" role="presentation">2233 3033</a> and <a href="tel:+852-2233-3322" class="no-link" role="presentation">2233 3322</a> respectively.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can additional cardholders apply for Samsung Pay?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, additional cardholders can apply for Samsung Pay using their additional cards. If your additional cardholder applies for the Samsung Pay successfully, both you and your cardholder will receive an email confirmation on the service. The use of Samsung Pay will be governed by a new mobile credit card addendum to credit card cardholder agreement which will need to be accepted during service application.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I use Samsung Pay if I have other HSBC Mobile Payments service (such as Apple Pay or Google Pay)?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, you can add your card to your compatible device to use Samsung Pay. If you use Google Pay on the same phone, you might need to set the default payment wallet under Settings> NFC> Tap and Pay.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I keep using Samsung Pay if I cancel my linked HSBC plastic card?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No, your Samsung Pay and your HSBC plastic card share the same card account. Your Samsung Pay will be cancelled together with the plastic card.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I use Samsung Pay with a rooted device?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No. Samsung Pay can only work on device which is not rooted.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is Samsung Pay free to use?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">HSBC will not charge you additional for using Samsung Pay.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Where can I use Samsung Pay?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Samsung Pay can be used at almost any merchants accepting credit card. With the Magnetic Secure Transmission (MST) technology, merchant that does not equipped with contactless card terminal can still accept Samsung Pay.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I use Samsung Pay overseas?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, With Samsung's technology Magnetic Secure Transaction (MST), Samsung Pay can be used almost everywhere around the globe. You are advised to bring your HSBC plastic card with you for travel in case Samsung Pay is not accepted.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Do I need to connect to internet when I am using Samsung Pay?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You do not need internet access to make purchases on Samsung Pay. However, internet access is required during setup or to refresh the information of your past transactions. It is suggested that the device should connect to the internet once per day to ensure that Samsung Pay stays up to date.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is there any limit for each transaction?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">There will be no limit for transactions conducted using Magnetic Secure Transmission (MST) technology. <br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For transactions conducted using NFC technology, the limit depends on the setting of the contactless terminal. For some of the contactless terminals, there is no transaction limit and you can transact up to your available credit limit; for some others, there might be a transaction limit of HK$500 or HK$1,000. </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For transactions that cannot be accepted by Samsung Pay, please use your HSBC plastic card.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Where can I check my transactions?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can check all your transactions made via Samsung Pay in HSBC Internet Banking, HSBC Mobile Banking App or the credit card statement. Transactions via Samsung Pay will be marked with “SAMSUNG PAY” under the transaction details. Other than that, you can also see the last 10 Samsung Pay transactions made via your device under your card in the Samsung Pay app.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Do I earn RewardCash for Samsung Pay transactions?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Samsung Pay transactions are treated the same as the other credit card transactions using the same RewardCash mechanism / policy. Please refer to RewardCash related webpages for the latest information.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I set my HSBC credit card as the default card for Samsung Pay?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">There is not a "default" card setting in Samsung Pay. When you open the app or swipe up, the first card displayed is either the last card you registered or the last card you viewed or used. Please swipe left or right to select your HSBC credit card for payment.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What should I do if I lose my device?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can call us on <a href="tel:+852-2233-3000" class="no-link" role="presentation">2233 3000</a> to report loss of your device. HSBC Global Private Banking, Premier Elite and HSBC Premier customers can call <a href="tel:+852-2233-3033" class="no-link" role="presentation">2233 3033</a> and <a href="tel:+852-2233-3322" class="no-link" role="presentation">2233 3322</a> respectively. Alternatively, you can use Samsung’s Find My Mobile service to Lock Samsung Pay (remotely disable) or to Wipe Samsung Pay (remove all the payment cards registered onto your device). You can set up Find My Mobile service by going to Settings> Security> Find My Mobile> Remote Controls. For details please visit <a href="https://findmymobile.samsung.com" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">https://findmymobile.samsung.com</span><span class="visuallyhidden">https://findmymobile.samsung.com  This link will open in a new window</span></a>.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What should I do if I lose my card?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please call us on <a href="tel:+852-2233-3000" class="no-link" role="presentation">2233 3000</a> immediately to report loss. HSBC Global Private Banking,  Premier Elite and HSBC Premier customers can call <a href="tel:+852-2233-3033" class="no-link" role="presentation">2233 3033</a> and <a href="tel:+852-2233-3322" class="no-link" role="presentation">2233 3322</a> respectively.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Once your plastic card are reported loss, you will not be able to continue to use Samsung Pay with this card.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What happens when I change my device to a new model?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you change your device to a new model, you will need to add your card(s) to Samsung Pay app again. Please ensure that you remove your card(s) from any device before selling, exchanging, or disposing of them. You can remove your card by selecting the card in the Samsung Pay app, then tap "delete card" in the menu at the top right hand corner.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What should I do if I want to trade in my phone or want to send my phone for servicing?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You are reminded to remove all your cards in that device by tapping "delete card" in the menu at the top right hand corner. You might also consider removing all your data (including Samsung Pay’s payment information) by factory reset or using Samsung’s Find My Mobile service to Lock Samsung Pay (remotely disable). For details please visit <a href="https://findmymobile.samsung.com">https://findmymobile.samsung.com</a><br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    

</div>
</div></div>

<div id="content_main_columnControl_17">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_21" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_7">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="Cash-instalment"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Cash Instalment plan
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_22" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <h3><strong>Do I save interest expenses by making early repayment of Cash Instalment Plan?</strong></h3>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_23" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The Monthly Instalment Amount is calculated by dividing the aggregate of the Loan and all the handling fees by the relevant number of instalments. The same handling fee will be charged for each instalment. You can choose to make early repayment, however, the total outstanding principal amount plus an early repayment fee calculated at 2% of such outstanding principal amount will be charged. For HSBC Privé, the early repayment fee is waived. If you choose to pay off the loan early, the loss may outweigh the gain as the amount of handling fee saved may not be enough to cover the relevant fees and charges for early repayment. You may contact us to check about the total amount involved in early repayment (including outstanding principal amount, early repayment fee and other fees, etc.). You should then compare the outstanding handling fee and early repayment fee and consider carefully before making a decision of repaying early or not.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_24" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <h3><strong>Can I request to make early repayment of the total outstanding amount? </strong></h3>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_25" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can choose to make early repayment, however, the total amount of outstanding principal amount plus an early repayment fee calculated at 2% of such outstanding principal amount will be charged. Therefore, you are advised to make careful consideration before making any early repayment decision. For HSBC Privé, the early repayment fee is waived.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_26" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <h3><strong>How long will it take and what will be the total cost to fully repay the Cash Instalment Plan by making minimum payments only?</strong></h3>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM M-BSCTBL-RW-RBWM" role="region"><div data-accessibility-tick-icon-text="available" data-accessibility-cross-icon-text="not available" id="content_main_basicTable_2" class="table-wrapper
            ">
    
    
        
        <table class="desktop">

<p><br>
The below examples are for illustration only. For customized information, please refer to our HSBC website (Borrowing>Credit Cards>Credit Card Repayment Calculator)</p>
    
</div>


                
            </caption>

<div class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL text-container text ">
    
    
        
        <p>INFORMATION REGARDING MAKING MINIMUM PAYMENT</p>
<p><br>
The below examples are for illustration only. For customized information, please refer to our HSBC website (Borrowing>Credit Cards>Credit Card Repayment Calculator)</p>
    
</div>


            
        </caption>
        <tbody>

            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">

    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="2110710998__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="2110710998__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other Cash Instalment Plan FAQs </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="2110710998__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_18">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_22" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_28" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Do I need to provide any supporting documents to apply for the Cash Instalment Plan?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">We may need you to upload your proof of income to complete your Cash Instalment Plan application. If you have applied via HSBC HK App, you can also submit your document through the app. A message prompting you to submit the document will be displayed at the following screens:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Application confirmation page</li> 
 <li>Go to ‘Create or view Cash Instalment Plan’ from your credit card account details page</li> 
 <li>Banners on the homepage or the credit card account details page of the app</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You may also submit your proof of income by clicking ‘Submit documents for Cash Instalment Plan’ under ‘Borrowing Cards and Loans’ on our public website; or mail it in by mentioning your HKID or credit card number on the income proof and marking it ‘for Cash Instalment Plan application’.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How much money can I request?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can request a minimum of HKD2,000 and a maximum equal to 100% of your unused credit limit on your designated HSBC credit card account.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Will interest be charged on my Cash Instalment Plan?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No interest will be charged on your Cash Instalment Plan if you make full repayment of the credit card's statement balance on or before the payment due date of each month; otherwise, interest which is calculated based on the prevailing interest rate applicable to the credit card account will be levied on all the outstanding balances.  Despite no interest being charged, there is personalised monthly handling fee for Cash Instalment Plan. You can call the application hotline or log on to HSBC HK App to enquire your monthly handling fee.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How would the Terms and Conditions of “Set-off” in the Credit Card Terms affect me?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The Terms and Conditions of set off gives us the right to combine or consolidate the outstanding balance on your Card Account with the balance on any other account which you maintain with us without prior notice.<br> In addition, if you are the primary cardholder, our right will extend to the outstanding balance on the Card Account of any Additional Cardholder.<br> We are entitled to transfer or set off any money standing to the credit of any other account which you maintain with us in or towards settlement of your liability to us.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What if I have difficulty in the repayment?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you have any difficulty in repaying any amount outstanding under the Cash Instalment Plan, you should notify us as soon as possible.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I apply to make an early repayment on the total outstanding amount of my Cash Instalment Plan?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please call us on <a href="tel:+852-2233-3000" class="no-link" role="presentation">(852) 2233 3000</a> to discuss your options.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>

</div>

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_31" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How much money can I request?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can request a minimum of HKD2,000 and a maximum equal to 100% of your unused credit limit on your designated HSBC credit card account.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Will I be charged interest?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Finance charge calculated at a preferential interest rate (per annum) (“Preferential Interest Rate”) will be charged on the outstanding Approved Withdrawal Amount on a daily basis, starting from the credit card monthly statement date immediately following the date of transfer of the Approved Withdrawal Amount to your designated account (which will be specified in the approval letter) until the credit card monthly statement date after the “Preferential Interest Rate End Date” (which will be specified in the approval letter). Thereafter, the finance charge will be calculated according to the same finance charge interest rate applicable to credit card as stipulated in the Tariff Guide. The finance charge will be calculated and accrued on a daily basis.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The Preferential Interest Rate only applies to the Approved Withdrawal Amount under the Cash Credit Plan. All other outstanding credit card balance including card purchases and cash advances will be subject to the interest rates and finance charges as set out in the Tariff Guide.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How would the Terms and Conditions of “Set-off” in the Credit Card Terms affect me?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The Terms and Conditions of set off gives us the right to combine or consolidate the outstanding balance on your Card Account with the balance on any other account which you maintain with us without prior notice.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">In addition, if you are the primary cardholder, our right will extend to the outstanding balance on the Card Account of any Additional Cardholder.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">We are entitled to transfer or set off any money standing to the credit of any other account which you maintain with us in or towards settlement of your liability to us.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What if I have difficulty in the repayment?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you have any difficulty in repaying any amount outstanding under the Cash Credit Plan, you should notify us as soon as possible.</p>
</div></div>

    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_9" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="361402784__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="361402784__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other Spending Instalment plan FAQs </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="361402784__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_22">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_26" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_36" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Do I need to provide sales slips of the transactions or other supporting documents to apply for a Spending Instalment Plan?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No - there is no supporting documentation are required for your application.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What's the minimum amount I can apply for?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Each application must be at least HKD1,000</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Will interest be charged on my Spending Instalment Plan?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No interest will be charged on your Spending Instalment Plan if you make full repayment of the credit card's statement balance on or before the payment due date of each month; otherwise, interest which is calculated based on the prevailing interest rate applicable to the credit card account will be levied on all the outstanding balances.  Despite no interest being charged, there is personalised monthly handling fee for Spending Instalment Plan. You can call the application hotline or log on to HSBC HK App to enquire your monthly handling fee.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How would the Terms and Conditions of “Set-off” in the Credit Card Terms affect me? </strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The Terms and Conditions of set off gives us the right to combine or consolidate the outstanding balance on your Card Account with the balance on any other account which you maintain with us without prior notice.<br> In addition, if you are the primary cardholder, our right will extend to the outstanding balance on the Card Account of any Additional Cardholder.<br> We are entitled to transfer or set off any money standing to the credit of any other account which you maintain with us in or towards settlement of your liability to us.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What if I have difficulty in the repayment?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you have any difficulty in repaying any amount outstanding under the Spending Instalment Plan, you should notify us as soon as possible.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What kind of purchase transactions are eligible and when do I need to apply?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Only posted purchase transactions effected with a Card qualify for the Spending Instalment Plan. Other transactions do not qualify and these transactions include the following:</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(i) any unposted, cancelled or refunded transaction; </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(ii) cash advance; </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(iii) instalment plan; </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(iv) Octopus AAVS (Octopus Automatic Add-Value Service); </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(v) withdrawal amount under a cash instalment plan and/or a cash credit plan; </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(vi) gambling transaction; </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(vii) purchase and/or reload of stored value cards or e-Wallets; </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(viii) transaction at non-financial institutions (including purchase of foreign currency, money orders and travellers cheques); </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(ix) transaction at financial institutions (including purchase of merchandise and services from banks); </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(x) wire transfers and; </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">(xi) all fees and charges.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You should apply at least 3 working days before the payment due date of the relevant eligible transaction.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I apply to make an early repayment on the total outstanding amount of my Spending Instalment Plan?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please call us on (852) 2233 3000 to discuss your options.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    

</div>
</div></div>

<div id="content_main_columnControl_23">

            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_10">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="Submit"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Submit supporting documents
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_37" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <h3><strong>What supporting documents are required for a credit card application?</strong></h3>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_38" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you are an existing HSBC customer with payroll account in HSBC and hold a HK Permanent ID Card, NO supporting document is required. If you would like to set up payroll account before applying for a credit card, please complete "Instruction Form for Setting Up/ Transfer of Salary Autopay".</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><br> Other customers, please provide:<br> </p> 
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Copy of HKID Card. If you are not holder of HK Permanent ID Card, please also provide copy of passport and employment contract with a contract period of at least 9 months from the date of submitting the application.</li> 
 <li>Income/Asset proof:</li> 
</ol> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">a) Regular Income Earner: latest 1 month bank book/statement/eStatement/online transaction history (showing applicant's name, account number and monthly income), or latest 1 month salary slip.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">b) Irregular Income Earner/Part-timer: latest 3 months bank book/statement/ eStatement/online transaction history (showing applicant's name, account number and monthly income), or latest 3 months salary slip.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">c) Self-Employed: latest tax demand note, or latest 3 months' bank book/statement/eStatement/online transaction history (showing company name, account number and transaction history) and current Business Registration Certificate and proof of ownership of business and previous 2 years Tax Return.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">d) Others: latest 3 months bank deposit/ bank book/ statement/ eStatement/ online transaction history in Hong Kong (showing applicant's name, account number and transaction history) or regular monthly rental income credited to applicant's bank account and the signed tenancy agreement.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_11" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_10" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="1057004055__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="1057004055__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other Submit supporting documents FAQs </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="1057004055__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_24">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_28" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_39" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is HSBC Online Document Submission Service?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">This allows you to upload supporting documents online. Transfers are confidential and automatically protected using SSL data encryption.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why has HSBC introduced this service?</strong><br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The service helps make applications easier by allowing you to submit your supporting documents 24 hours a day, 7 days a week through the website or Personal Internet Banking.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What are the system requirements for the Online Document Submission Service?</strong></p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>A computer with Internet connection</li> 
 <li>This site is best viewed with Microsoft Internet Explorer 6.0 SP2 or above</li> 
 <li>Optimised for Screen Resolution of 1024 x 768</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I be sure I am connected to HSBC?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">HSBC employs the latest internet security measure with the adoption of the EV SSL Certificate (Extended Validation SSL Certificate) which will instantly let you know that you're on a genuine HSBC website.<br> <br> You will see a change to the URL address bar area at the top of your browser when you visit the secure sessions in the HSBC website (indicated by "https://" at the beginning of the URL). The name of the certificate owner (The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited) will be displayed either on the URL address bar or near the top of the browser. This indicates the successful verification of the site's identity.<br> <br> The changes will look slightly different depending on the browser you use:</p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>Internet Explorer: The URL address bar will turn green with the company and certificate issuer names displayed.</li> 
 <li>Firefox: The name of the company will be highlighted in green inside the URL address bar.</li> 
 <li>Safari: The name of the company will be shown in green near the top right corner of browser.</li> 
 <li>Google Chrome: The URL address bar will turn yellow and display the name of the company.</li> 
</ul> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What type of image formats can I submit?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">PDF, JPEG, GIF or TIFF files are accepted. The file size must not exceed 2 MB (a maximum of 10MB for 5 files). The image resolution of supporting document(s) should be 200dpi or above.<br> The file name should not:</p> 
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>contain any spaces</li> 
 <li>contain non-English characters</li> 
 <li>contain special characters (except _.@-+!#[]()~)</li> 
 <li>exceed 50 characters (including file extension).</li> 
</ol> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Where can I upload documents for a personal credit card application?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="https://www.hsbc.com.hk/personal/credit-cards/doc-upload.html">Upload supporting documents for a credit card application</a></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Where can I upload documents for a loan application?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><a href="/loans/documents-required/">Upload supporting documents for a loan application</a></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I submit the documentation later by using HSBC Online Document Submission Service after my Credit Card or Loan application submission?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, you can upload supporting documents after your application for a loan or credit card has been submitted.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If I am overseas, can I still use this service?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can still use this service when you are overseas.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What is the maximum number of documents I can upload each time?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can upload maximum five files each time. The file size must not exceed 2MB for each file.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I applied for a personal credit card /personal loan through HSBC Branch / Call centre, can I also submit the document via online?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, you can use this service to submit the supporting document(s) even if you have applied for a credit card or personal loan through an HSBC branch or call centre.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I find the application reference number?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">An application reference number will be displayed after you have submitted your application online. You can leave the field blank if you cannot find the application reference number.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I have mistyped the application reference number, would that affect the application process?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">It will not affect the application process if you mistyped the application reference number. If you mistyped the HKID or passport number, please resubmit the document once again with the correct HKID and passport number.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I forgot my application reference number, can I still upload the document?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can still upload the document if you forgot the application number.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I cancel the document upload while it is in progress?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No, you cannot cancel the document upload while it is in progress.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I know if the document is successfully uploaded?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You will receive a confirmation page listed the uploaded file name(s) of the document upon successfully upload.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If the internet connection is unintentionally terminated while upload is in progress, what should I do? Do I have to upload all the documents again?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, please upload all the documents again as HSBC will not receive the documents if there is any problem with the internet connection during the upload process.</p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>If my Personal Internet Banking session has timed out and logged off automatically while upload is in progress, what should I do?</strong></p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">While upload is in progress, your Personal Internet Banking session will not affect the upload process.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    

</div>
</div></div>

    <div class="row">

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_40" class="remove-bottom-space A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <h3><strong>What is 2 Way SMS?</strong><br> </h3>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_41" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If we see a suspicious transaction on your credit card, we'll send you an SMS alert. The message will ask you to reply to let us know whether the transaction is genuine.<br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_42" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <h3><strong>What should I do if I receive a 2 Way SMS for a transaction I made?</strong><br> </h3>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>

<div id="content_main_columnControl_27">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-50-50  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_31" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-IMG-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_image_7" class="smart-image">
        
            
            <figure class="smart-image-figure">
                
    
    
    <picture id="content_main_image_8">
        
        
        
        <source srcset="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/messages/email/salesforce/personal-banking/full-width-tile/16057-trustworthy-co-hk-servicing-fraud-en-660x496.jpg 1x" media="(min-width: 960px)">

        <source srcset="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/messages/email/salesforce/personal-banking/full-width-tile/16057-trustworthy-co-hk-servicing-fraud-en-660x496.jpg/jcr:content/renditions/cq5dam.web.490.1000.jpeg 1x">
        
    <img id="content_main_image_9" class="A-IMAGE-RW-ALL smart-image-img" role="img" src="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/messages/email/salesforce/personal-banking/full-width-tile/16057-trustworthy-co-hk-servicing-fraud-en-660x496.jpg" alt="Reply Y SMS mobile screen, image use for what should I do if i receive a 2 way sms for a transacion I made.">

    </picture>
    


                
            </figure>
        
    </div>
</div>

        
    


        </div>
    
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_32" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_43" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR14R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR14R-RW-ALL"><strong><span class="A-TYP16B-RW-ALL">Reply with 'Yes' or 'Y' if you recognise the transaction</span></strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Then check if the transaction is successful. On some occasions, payment may be declined due to security reasons. If that happens, you'll need to make the transaction again.</p>
</div></div>

</div>

<div id="content_main_columnControl_28">

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_44" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <h3><strong>What should I do if I receive a 2 Way SMS for a transaction I didn't make?</strong><br> </h3>

            <div class="M-IMG-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_image_10" class="smart-image">
        
            
            <figure class="smart-image-figure">
                
    
    
    <picture id="content_main_image_11">
        
        
        
        <source srcset="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/messages/email/salesforce/personal-banking/full-width-tile/16057-screen-en-660x496.jpg 1x" media="(min-width: 960px)">

        <source srcset="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/messages/email/salesforce/personal-banking/full-width-tile/16057-screen-en-660x496.jpg/jcr:content/renditions/cq5dam.web.490.1000.jpeg 1x">
        
    <img id="content_main_image_12" class="A-IMAGE-RW-ALL smart-image-img" role="img" src="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/messages/email/salesforce/personal-banking/full-width-tile/16057-screen-en-660x496.jpg" alt="Reply N SMS mobile screen, image use for what should I do if i receive a 2 way sms for a transacion I didn't made.">

    </picture>
    


                
            </figure>
        
    </div>
</div>

        
    


        </div>
    
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_35" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_45" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Reply with 'No' or 'N' if you do not recognise the transaction or the details are incorrect</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">We'll decline the transaction and block your card. We'll also reach out to you between 9am-10:30pm HKT to understand more about this. You can help fight fraud too. Get in touch with us immediately after you've responded with 'N'.</p>
</div></div>
