            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_12" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_11" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    <div class="anchor" id="sms"></div>

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="98401151__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="98401151__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other 2 Ways SMS FAQ </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="98401151__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_30">
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100 ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_36" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_46" class="remove-bottom-space A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I tell if a message is really from HSBC, or from a fraudster?</strong><br> </p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_47" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Fraudsters might impersonate us and send you messages, asking you to provide sensitive personal information or click on a link.<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">We may send you alerts to keep you up to date on your account activities or to check that a transaction is genuine. However, we will never ask you to provide sensitive personal information such as your identity document number, credit card details (credit card number, expiry date, card verification value printed on the back of credit card), online banking passwords or one-time password (OTP).<br> </p> 
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you receive an SMS asking for this kind of information, please stay alert, and:<br> </p> 
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL"> 
 <li>do not disclose any sensitive personal details<br> </li> 
 <li>do not reply to it or click any of the links</li> 
 <li>contact us to verify or report the message</li> 
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    

</div>
        </section>
    </div>

    </div>

</div>

        
    

</div>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    <div class="anchor" id="verification"></div>

<div id="content_main_columnControl_31">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_37" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-TITLE-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region"><div id="content_main_title_12">
    
    <div class="anchor" id="otp"></div>

    <h2 class="A-BBST28R-RW-ALL">
            Verification Code for Online Transaction/HSBC HK App Online Transaction Authentication Service
    </h2>
    <div class="row">
        <div class="sm-12 organismsContainer">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_48" class="remove-bottom-space A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why are you introducing HSBC HK App Online Transaction Authentication Service?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_49" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">This is a robust new service which allows you to review and approve online payments safely and conveniently in the HSBC HK App, after successful log on.</p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_50" class="remove-bottom-space A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why do I need a verification code/perform transaction authentication in HSBC HK App for online transactions?</strong></p>
</div></div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_51" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Some online merchants use 3D Secure to improve the security of online purchases. When you make an online transaction using your HSBC credit or debit card you may be asked to approve the purchase using a verification code or give approval in the mobile app.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you've already set up your HSBC HK App and have verified your identify, we’ll send an authentication request to the app so you can approve the payment safely with your 6-digit Mobile Banking PIN or biometric authentication (Touch ID/Face ID/fingerprint) on supported devices.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you’re not a registered user of the HSBC HK App a verification code will be sent via SMS to your registered mobile number. Simply enter the verification code in merchant’s payment page to authenticate your transaction.</p>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_32">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_38" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ACCRD-RW-RBWM row" role="region"><div>
    
    <div id="content_main_accordion_13" class="accordions-container sm-12">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV O-ADVEXP-RW-RBWM row" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_advanced_expander_12" class="sm-12 clear-float">
        
    <div class="anchor" id="otp"></div>

        
    
    <div class="A-EXPCNT-RW-RBWM expander">
        <div class="dropdown" aria-controls="-62450208__panel0" role="button" tabindex="0" aria-expanded="false">
            <h3 id="-62450208__tab0" class="dropdown-text">Other Verification Code for Online Transaction/HSBC HK App Online Transaction Authentication Service FAQs </h3>
            <span class="chevron"></span>
        </div>
        <section id="-62450208__panel0" class="exp-content" aria-hidden="true" tabindex="-1">
            <div class="exp-panel">




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_33">
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100 ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_39" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_52" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Will I need to use a verification code or perform transaction authentication in HSBC HK App for all my online transactions?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No, you'll only need to do this when you make online transactions with merchants that support 3D Secure.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Do verification codes or transaction authentication requests sent to HSBC HK App expire?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Yes, a verification code will expire 100 seconds after it's been issued. If the code expires before you use it, you can select 'Resend code' on the transaction page to get a new code sent to your registered mobile number and try again.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please note that verification codes can only be resent twice per transaction. If you ask for the code to be resent twice in a row without entering the correct verification code, you won't be able to complete the transaction. Instead, you'll be redirected back to the merchant's website to restart the transaction.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For HSBC HK App Online Transaction Authentication Service, the request will expire 3 minutes after it’s been sent for authentication. If the request expires, you’ll need to return to the merchant’s website and try again.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I still receive verification codes or use HSBC HK App Online Transaction Authentication Service if I'm abroad?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you’re a registered user of the HSBC HK App, you can still use the app to authenticate online payments abroad.  Otherwise, if you're abroad and using an overseas telecommunication service provider, you may not receive international SMSs if your provider doesn’t support it. You may also experience a delay in receiving the SMS.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I register for verification codes or HSBC HK App Online Transaction Authentication Service and how much does it cost? </strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">This is a free service, and you don't need to register for it.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Users of the HSBC HK App will authenticate credit and debit card payments on the app. If you’re not registered for the app we’ll send a verification code via SMS to the mobile number you’ve registered with us. Please make sure it’s a current, valid number.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How do I authenticate an online payment through the HSBC HK App?</strong><br> After you've entered your card details on the merchant’s website/app supporting 3D Secure, we'll send you a push notification on your device to authenticate the transaction. Tap on the push notification and follow the instruction to approve the payment.</p>
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
 <li>Check the transaction details and make sure they match your order.</li>
</ul>
</div></div>

        
    


        </div>
    </div>
</div>
</div>

        
    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">

            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_53" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
 <li>Log on to your HSBC HK App and review the payment details. Select ‘Approve’ if you're happy to proceed. <br></li>
 <li>If you don’t recognise the transaction or the payment details don’t match your order, select ‘Reject’ to decline the payment. You may temporarily block your card via ‘Didn’t recognise transaction?’ and report any suspicious transactions via ‘Chat with us’.</li>
</ul>
</div></div>

<div id="content_main_columnControl_36">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-50-50  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_43" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-IMG-RW-DEV O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV" role="region">
    <div id="content_main_image_16" class="smart-image">

        <source srcset="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/messages/email/salesforce/personal-banking/full-width-tile/13088-step-3-single-txn-mobile-app-approval-page-en-660x496.jpg 1x" media="(min-width: 480px)">
        <source srcset="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/messages/email/salesforce/personal-banking/full-width-tile/13088-step-3-single-txn-mobile-app-approval-page-en-660x496.jpg/jcr:content/renditions/cq5dam.web.490.1000.jpeg 1x">

            <div class="cc-wrapper O-COLCTRL-RW-DEV" role="region">
    

<div id="content_main_columnControl_37">
    
    <div class="cc cc-columns-100  ">
        
        <div id="content_main_columnControlColumn_45" class="cc-column">
            




    
        
        
            
            
            
            
            <div class="M-CONTMAST-RW-RBWM O-SMARTSPCGEN-DEV rich-text" role="region"><div id="content_main_richtext_54" class=" A-PAR16R-RW-ALL-WRAPPER" data-date-format="D/M/YYYY" data-time-format="HH:MM:SS A" data-zone="Hongkong">
    <ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
 <li>Once you’ve approved it in the HSBC HK App, return to the merchant’s website/app and follow the on-screen instructions to complete the payment.</li>
</ul>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I'm already logged on to the HSBC HK App and made an online transaction on a merchant's website/app. When I go back to the HSBC HK App I can't find any authentication request. How can I approve the transaction?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Online transaction authentication via the HSBC HK App needs to be completed within 3 minutes. If you’re already logged on to the HSBC HK App and have received a push notification on your device for the transaction, please tap on the push notification and follow the instruction to approve the payment. If you haven’t received a push notification, then please log off and log back on to approve the transaction.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I receive push notifications? I'd like to receive alerts for my online transactions that require authentication via the mobile app.</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"></p><p>If you already have push notifications turned on, then you're all set to receive our fraud alerts. Otherwise, please follow these instructions to turn on push notifications in the HSBC HK App:</p>
<p>Step 1: Log on to the HSBC HK App</p>
<p>Step 2: Tap the bell icon on the top right</p>
<p>Step 3: Select 'Confirm’ to turn on push notifications</p>
<p>Follow the rest of the instructions on the app to fully set up your preferences. To understand more about our Push Notification Service Alerts, you can check out our <a href="/mobile/faq/#noti" target="_self" rel="noopener noreferrer">FAQs</a>.</p>
<p></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Why can't I proceed with the transaction authentication after tapping on the push notification?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Your transaction might have timed out. Please resubmit your payment on the merchant’s website/app, then tap on the push notification and authenticate the transaction on the HSBC HK App. You need to do this within 3 minutes from the time that the transaction is initiated.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What happens if I make more than one transaction, but only tap on one of the push notifications?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">When you tap on a push notification and authenticate the transaction on the HSBC HK App, you’ll see a 'Next transaction' button to proceed to the next valid transaction.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I'd like to authenticate online transactions using One Time Passwords (OTPs) received via SMS, instead of using the HSBC HK App. How can I do that?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"></p><p>HSBC HK App Online Transaction Authentication Service is a secure new service which allows you to review and approve online payments safely and conveniently on the HSBC HK App, after successful log on. To change your preference for online transaction authentication, please call our customer service hotline.</p>
<p>HSBC Global Private Banking customers: <a href="tel:+852-2233-3033" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" class="no-link" role="presentation"><span aria-hidden="true">(852) 2233 3033</span><span class="visuallyhidden">(852) 2233 3033  This link will open in a new window</span></a></p>
<p>HSBC Premier Elite customers: <a href="tel:+852-2233-3033" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" class="no-link" role="presentation"><span aria-hidden="true">(852) 2233 3033</span><span class="visuallyhidden">(852) 2233 3033  This link will open in a new window</span></a></p>
<p>HSBC Premier customers: <a href="tel:+852-2233-3322" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" class="no-link" role="presentation"><span aria-hidden="true">(852) 2233 3322</span><span class="visuallyhidden">(852) 2233 3322  This link will open in a new window</span></a></p>
<p>Other personal banking customers: <a href="tel:+852-2233-3000" target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" class="no-link" role="presentation"><span aria-hidden="true">(852) 2233 3000</span><span class="visuallyhidden">(852) 2233 3000  This link will open in a new window</span></a></p>
<p></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Will I be charged for using verification codes for online transactions?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No, the verification code for online transaction service is free as long as you're receiving the One-Time Passcode (OTP) by SMS in Hong Kong.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you're overseas or using overseas telecommunication service providers, your service provider might charge you. Please check with your service provider for more details.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I’ve previously authenticated my transactions in HSBC HK App when shopping online with this 3D Secure participating merchant. Why did you send me a verification code this time?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">To keep improving, we need to regularly maintain and update our banking services.  During these periods, selected services including the HSBC HK App may be unavailable. So we don’t affect your card usage, a verification code will be sent to your registered mobile number instead for transaction authentication.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What happens if I enter the wrong verification code 3 times in a row?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You won't be able to complete the transaction. Instead, you'll be redirected back to the merchant's website. You may be asked to enter your credit or debit card information again and use another verification code to complete the transaction.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>What should I do if I lose my mobile phone?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please report the loss to your telecommunication service provider immediately and ask them to suspend telecommunication services on your mobile phone.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">This will help prevent unauthorised parties from completing transactions using verification codes sent to your mobile phone in the event they have your credit or debit card information.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Please call us to suspend your online banking account immediately and prevent anyone else from accessing your accounts.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">HSBC Global Private Banking customers: <a href="tel:852-2233-3033" class="no-link" role="presentation">(852) 2233 3033</a></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">HSBC Premier Elite customers: <a href="tel:852-2233-3033" class="no-link" role="presentation">(852) 2233 3033</a></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">HSBC Premier customers: <a href="tel:852-2233-3322" class="no-link" role="presentation">(852) 2233 3322</a></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Other personal banking customers: <a href="tel:852-2233-3000" class="no-link" role="presentation">(852) 2233 3000</a></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I opt out of using verification code or HSBC HK App Online Transaction Authentication Service for online transactions?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No, you can't. This service is to help you protect your account against financial crime when you make online transactions with merchants that support 3D Secure.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You'll need to approve or reject transactions in the HSBC HK App if you’re a registered user, or if not, receive a 6-digit verification code sent to your registered mobile number by SMS. You'll then need to enter the code to authenticate your transaction.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I have changed my mobile number. How do I register or update my mobile number so I can receive One Time Passwords (OTPs) via SMS?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can update your mobile number and email address via the HSBC HK App by following these steps:</p>
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL">
 <li>Log on to HSBC HK App.</li>
 <li>Tap on the profile icon in the top right corner of your screen.</li>
 <li>Swipe the name card or tap on  'Contact details' under 'Settings and preferences' to enter the 'Contact details' page.</li>
 <li>Your mobile number and email address will be displayed on the 'Contact details' page. You can now update any of these fields by selecting the edit button next to them.<br> <br> Note: you can only update these fields if you have a valid mobile number and/or email address in our records. If you only have either one which is valid and wish to do the update the other, you can only add/update the missing/invalid detail with your HKID via HSBC HK App.</li>
</ol>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Alternatively, you can register or update your mobile number by downloading the form for your card type, completing and submitting it to us.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For personal customers:</p>
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL">
 <li>Download and complete the '<a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/accounts/change-customer-contact.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">Change of Address/Telephone Number/Fax Number/Email Address Instruction Form (For Personal Customer)</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Change of Address/Telephone Number/Fax Number/Email Address Instruction Form (For Personal Customer)  This link will open in a new window</span></a>'</li>
 <li>Mail it to: The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited, P O Box 72677, Kowloon Central Post Office, Kowloon, Hong Kong<br> <br> For commercial credit cards:</li>
</ol>
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL">
 <li>Download and complete the '<a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/accounts/bussiness-card-programme-amendment-request-form.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">Program Amendment Request Form</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Program Amendment Request Form  This link will open in a new window</span></a>'</li>
 <li>Mail it to: Card Centre, 8/F HSBC Centre, Tower 2 & 3, No. 1 Sham Mong Road, Kowloon, Hong Kong</li>
</ol>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I've just updated my mobile number at a branch or on HSBC HK App. When will I be able to receive One Time Passwords (OTPs) via SMS on my new number, to verify online transactions?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">Your mobile number is updated instantly in your profile via the app. However, it can take up to 4 working days for your other accounts (such as cards, insurance, or MPF) to reflect this change.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If the change request is submitted to our branch, it may take about 4 working days to process it before you can receive SMS OTPs on your new number for verifying online transactions.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Is the 6-digit verification code made of numbers or a combination of letters and numbers?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">The verification code is made up of 6 numbers.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>Can I use my local/mainland China/overseas number to receive verification codes for online transactions?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can use a local, mainland China or overseas number as long as you can receive SMSs with it and it doesn’t have call forwarding services set up.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">If you're using a mainland China or overseas number, please provide the country/region code. You may also wish to refer to these FAQ items:</p>
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
 <li>Will I be charged for using verification codes for online transactions?</li>
 <li>Can I still receive verification codes or use HSBC HK App Online Transaction Authentication Service if I'm abroad?</li>
</ul>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I'm not registered to use the HSBC HK App and I haven’t given you a mobile number, can I still use verification codes for online transactions?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No, you won't be able to receive verification codes to complete online transactions with your HSBC credit or debit card at merchants that support 3D Secure, if we don't have your valid mobile number in our records.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">See ‘How can I register or update my mobile number?’</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>I'm registered to the HSBC HK App and I haven’t given you a mobile number, can I still authenticate online transactions in the HSBC HK App?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">No, you won't be able to complete online transaction authentication in the HSBC HK App, if we don't have your valid mobile number in our records.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">See ‘How can I register or update my mobile number?’</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I register or update my mobile number?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">There are a few ways you can register or update your mobile number with us, depending on your card type. If you want to use a mainland China or overseas number, please provide the country/region code.</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">For personal customers:</p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can update your mobile number and email address via the HSBC HK App by following these steps:</p>
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL">
 <li>Log on to HSBC HK App.</li>
 <li>Tap on the profile icon in the top right corner of your screen.</li>
 <li>Swipe the name card or tap on 'Contact details' under 'Settings and preferences' to enter the 'Contact details' page.</li>
</ol>
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
 <li>Your mobile number and email address will be displayed on the 'Contact details' page. You can now update any of these fields by selecting the edit button next to them.</li>
 <li>Please note that you can only update these fields if you have a valid mobile number and/or email address in our records. If you only have either one which is valid and wish to do the update the other, you can only add/update the missing/invalid detail with your HKID via HSBC HK App.</li>
</ul>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><br> By post</p>
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL">
 <li>Download and complete the '<a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/accounts/change-customer-contact.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">Change of Address/Telephone Number/Fax Number/Email Address Instruction Form (For Personal Customer)</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Change of Address/Telephone Number/Fax Number/Email Address Instruction Form (For Personal Customer)  This link will open in a new window</span></a>'</li>
 <li>Mail it to: The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited, P O Box 72677, Kowloon Central Post Office, Kowloon, Hong Kong<br> <br> For commercial credit cards:</li>
</ol>
<ol class="A-LSTO-RW-ALL">
 <li>Download and complete the '<a href="/content/dam/hsbc/hk/docs/accounts/bussiness-card-programme-amendment-request-form.pdf" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">Program Amendment Request Form</span><span class="visuallyhidden">Program Amendment Request Form  This link will open in a new window</span></a>'</li>
 <li>Mail it to: Card Centre, 8/F HSBC Centre, Tower 2 & 3, No. 1 Sham Mong Road, Kowloon, Hong Kong</li>
</ol>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"> </p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL"><strong>How can I protect myself and prevent my credit card information or verification codes from being used for unauthorised online transactions?</strong></p>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">There are several ways you can safeguard yourself against financial crime, starting with your devices.</p>
<ul class="A-LSTU-RW-ALL">
 <li>Don’t disclose your verification codes to third parties.</li>
 <li>Set a hard-to-guess passcode on your mobile devices and set your screens to lock automatically.</li>
 <li>Update your operating system, web browser and HSBC HK App to their latest versions to keep them secure. Don’t jailbreak or root your devices.</li>
 <li>Beware of viruses, especially on your mobile devices. Don’t enter any personal or credit card information in any apps unless you're sure it's from a trusted source, as it could be a phishing attack. Install and update your security software promptly and download and update your apps via reliable sources such as the app store for your device only.</li>
 <li>Don’t browse suspicious websites or open hyperlinks and attachments in dubious emails, SMSs or chats.</li>
 <li>Disable wireless network functions (eg Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, NFC, etc) and Virtual Private Networks (VPNs) when you're not using them. Choose encrypted networks when you use Wi-Fi and remove unnecessary Wi-Fi connection settings.</li>
</ul>
<p class="A-PAR16R-RW-ALL">You can find more tips on our <a href="/help/cybersecurity-and-fraud/" target="_self">cyber security and fraud hub</a>. If you have a business, you might like to explore our page on how to <a href="https://www.business.hsbc.com.hk/en-gb/hk/campaign/build-a-cyber-aware-business" target="_blank" rel="noopener"><span aria-hidden="true">build a cyber-aware business</span><span class="visuallyhidden">build a cyber-aware business  This link will open in a new window</span></a>.<br></p>
</div></div>
